string.text: Boar Chop

A chunk of meat harvested from a mutant boar, tough and gamey but edible with proper cooking. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Low-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Bloodsucker Meat

Flesh cut from a slain Bloodsucker, its rubbery, stringy texture making it unappealing and thus not suited for eating. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Chimera Meat

A rare and highly dangerous cut taken from the ferocious Chimera, known for its tough muscle fibers and unique taste. Since they are considered one of the most dangerous creatures, their meat is highly valued by veteran stalkers.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Dog Meat

Meat harvested from feral Zone dogs, stringy and unpleasant but occasionally eaten as a cheap alternative to the more popular boar meat. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Low-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Flesh Meat

A common source of mutant protein from the slow-moving Flesh creatures, surprisingly palatable when cooked properly. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Low-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Lurker Meat

Tough, sinewy meat carved from a Lurker, best suited for stew due to its rubbery consistency. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Pseudodog Meat

Highly nutritious meat from a mutant Pseudodog, known to me more edible than its regular canine counterparts. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Low-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Psysucker Meat

Similar to Bloodsuckers, Psysucker meat has a rubbery, stringy texture and is thus not suited for eating. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Tushkano Meat

A small portion of meat from the rodent-like Tushkano, barely enough for a meal. While relatively safe compared to larger mutants, it’s often considered scavenger food. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Low-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Snork Hand

A severed, clawed hand from a Snork, usually kept as a trophy or proof of a kill rather than for consumption. Though technically edible, most stalkers avoid it as it is seen to be cannibalistic and immoral. Note that consuming uncooked mutant meat always carries the risk of contamination or radiation exposure.
 
 %c[ui_red]WARNING: Raw Meat
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Low-tier Mutant Meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cookable
Bloodsucker Goulash

A small dense, iron-rich stew made from the sinewy flesh of a Bloodsucker, spiced with various herbs and mushrooms.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Cooked Meal
Boar Chops

Thick cuts of boar meat, seasoned with salt and various herbs. Easily the most popular warm meal among stalkers.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cooked Meal
Dog Chops

Lean and fibrous cuts from the flesh of the Zone’s wild dogs. Their sharp, gamy flavor is complimented with various herbs. A cheap alternative to the more popular boar beef.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cooked Meal
Flesh Bacon

Strips of fatty Flesh meat, cooked until crispy and surprisingly flavorful. It’s one of the more palatable mutant meals.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cooked Meal
Cooked Snork Hand

A grotesque delicacy, cooked until the skin cracks and the meat pulls away from the bone. Most stalkers eat it on a dare or include it in their meals to show their superiority over others.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cooked Meal
Lurker Chops

Tough slabs of mutant Lurker meat, slow cooked to tenderize the dense flesh, and seasoned with salt and various herbs. With the right marinade, it’s surprisingly flavorful, though most stalkers consider it an acquired taste at best.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Cooked Meal
Chimera Goulash

A rare and exotic dish made from Chimera meat, carefully cooked to break down its dense muscle fibers and served alongside mushrooms and various spices. An expensive meal, eaten most commonly by veteran stalkers to celebrate the accomplishment of difficult missions.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Cooked Meal
Pseudodog Chops

Thick slices of pseudodog meat, grilled until well-done to ensure safety. The meat is rich and gamey and offers good nutritional value due to the creature's thick muscles.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cooked Meal
Psysucker Goulash

A heavily boiled stew made from Psysucker meat, loaded with herbs to counteract its unsettling origins. Despite being deemed safe to eat, some stalkers report vivid, intrusive dreams after consuming it, but this is only speculation.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] High-tier Cooked Meal
Rat Skewers

Skewers of grilled Tushkano meat, often heavily seasoned to disguise the flavor. Cheap, common, and just filling enough to keep a hungry stalker moving.
 
 %c[pda_white]NOTE: %c[ui_gray_2]The quality and healthiness of a meal is determined by how it is prepared.
 %c[d_orange] • %c[pda_white] Zone-produced meals%c[ui_gray_2], while less contaminated, are still unhealthy.
 %c[pda_yellow] • %c[pda_white] Stewed meals %c[ui_gray_2]require the addition of clean water and are significantly less contaminated.
 %c[d_green] • %c[pda_white] Purified meals %c[ui_gray_2]required the addition of vodka and are not only radiation-free but provide revitalizing effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[pda_white] Cooked Meal
Boar Leg

A preserved limb from a mutant boar, the hooves of which contain keratin and other biological compounds that can be broken down and refined into components for various drugs and medications. In the Zone, these materials are particularly valued for their use in crafting painkillers, coagulants, and improvised stimulants.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Bloodsucker Heart

The Bloodsucker’s heart secretes a rare enzyme that prevents blood from clotting, allowing the creature to feed more efficiently on its prey. Scientists studying this enzyme believe it could be adapted into powerful anticoagulant medications or possibly used to halt the coagulation process caused by incompatible blood types, solving the problem of blood donor issues for patients with rare blood types.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Bloodsucker Jaw

Similar to the Bloodsucker’s heart, its tentacles secrete a rare enzyme that prevents blood from clotting, allowing the creature to feed more efficiently on its prey. Scientists studying this enzyme believe it could be adapted into powerful anticoagulant medications or possibly used to halt the coagulation process caused by incompatible blood types, solving the problem of blood donor issues for patients with rare blood types. Some stalkers also use their teeth to make necklaces and charms.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Boar Fang

The fang of a Zone boar measuring an average length of 30 centimeters. These are of no particular interest to scientists due to their lackluster composition and strength, though the fang is instead commonly used as a trophy among stalkers or as a collector's item outside of the Zone.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Burer Brain

Burers have telepathic skills yet to be understood by the science community, with the average mass being 1.5 to 2.5 times bigger than a human brain. Its structure also shows significant mutation, hinting at the Zone’s influence on cognition. These are therefore highly sought-after by scientists.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Burer Hand

A shriveled, claw-like hand from a Burer, believed to be key to its telekinetic abilities. Scientists examine its unique musculature and nerve clusters, while some stalkers collect it for occult purposes.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Cat Claw

A sharp, curved talon from a mutant cat, molecular structure unknown. Its serrated edges show adaptations for hunting in the Zone’s unforgiving terrain. Scientists and military believe that a thorough study will help in the creation of new, highly durable materials and armor.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Cat Tail

Cats in the Zone are bigger than their pet cousins and are very dangerous predators, capable of moving swiftly and without sound. Within the stalker community, a cat's tail is a symbol of awareness and competency.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Cat Thyroid

A rare gland from a mutant cat, believed to regulate its metabolism in the highly irradiated environment. Scientists suspect it plays a role in the cat’s heightened reflexes and aggression. These traits have allowed them to quickly displace their healthy relatives and occupy a higher position in the food chain.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Chimera Claw

The claw of a Chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but it is as durable and sharp as a diamond. Valued for both scientific study and trophy collections, its bone structure is unusually dense, adapted for tearing through armor and flesh alike.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Chimera Heart

The Chimera’s heart has mutated into a dual-chambered organ, essentially functioning as two hearts fused together to pump blood at incredible rates. This adaptation allows the mutant to sustain its extreme bursts of speed and power, ensuring constant oxygen flow to its massive muscles during relentless attacks. These are currently sought after to aid in the study of Siamese twin death rates.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Chimera Horn

The horn of a Chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but the tip is as durable and sharp as a diamond. Some stalkers believe it has mystical properties, while scientists see it as a product of extreme environmental adaptation. These are in high demand and very valuable as they are sought after by collectors outside the Zone.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Controller Brain Tissue

Samples of heavily mutated brain matter from a Controller. Researchers study it to understand the source of the creature’s mind control abilities, while scientific studies have found that every mutant possessing abilities related to psy-waves have a brain of similar structure. The scientists will pay handsomely for this tissue.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Controller Hand

A grotesque, skeletal hand from a Controller, its fingertips oddly elongated and sensitive. Some believe these hands play a role in channeling psy-waves, though the data remains inconclusive. They will gladly examine it in the hope of finding the source of mutation responsible.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Dog Heart

While in pursuit, a mutated dog's heart can reach up to 250 beats per minute, which is unthinkable for non-atherogenic, healthy individuals of the same weight category. This rapid heartbeat allows the creature to react faster, sustain long chases, and recover quickly from exertion, making their heart an interesting subject for study.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Dog Liver

The liver of a dog, having undergone severe changes due to a toxic diet and a lack of clean drinking water in the Zone. Researchers use it to study how mutant dogs survive in the Zone’s toxic ecosystem and for its potential in aiding research in medicine for liver diseases.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Dog Tail

Resistance of mutant dog skin to electricity and chemical agents has been the object of scientific interest for a long time. Due to the absence of fat tissue, the tail is especially suited for lab tests. When not studied, these are sometimes kept as a trophy as proof of a stalker's kill.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Flesh Eye

A large, disturbingly human-like eye from the Flesh mutant, often preserved for study for its miraculous regenerative abilities. The discovery of this mechanism would most certainly revolutionize modern medicine.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Fracture Hand

A twisted, gnarled hand from a Fracture mutant, with elongated fingers adapted for grasping prey. Its mutated bone and muscle structure are of interest to biologists studying rapid evolutionary changes in the Zone. It is almost certain that these creatures used to be humans and are the direct result of the second Chernobyl incident.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Lurker Eye

A small, highly sensitive predatory eye taken from a Lurker, giving the creature an edge in ambushes. Useful in studying mutant vision, the glow surrounding the pupil makes these a matter of interest among local hunters and scientists.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Lurker Tail

A whip-like tail with flexible muscle and sharp bone ridges, used for balance and combat purposes. Scientific studies suggest that the characteristics of a Lurker tail are proof that they are a mutant species of Tushkano.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Mutated Crow Beak

While many stalkers consider crows no more than pests, more insightful individuals pulverize the beaks to be used in creating special mixtures. Scientists study these to understand how even airborne creatures are affected by the Zone.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Pseudodog Fang

Pseudodog fangs are not particularly strong and are routinely replaced throughout life. Scientists are not particularly interested in them, though stalkers sometimes make them into necklaces or jewelry.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Pseudodog Tail

The tail of a Pseudodog, the fur of which is incredibly soft despite the creature’s brutal nature. This adaptation seems to provide insulation against the Zone’s harsh weather and radiation exposure. Scientists study its unique properties, hoping to uncover how the fur resists contamination and whether it could inspire new protective materials.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Pseudogiant Eye

A massive, bloodshot eye from the hulking Pseudogiant. It has the appearance of a human eye with a multi-colored iris and exceptionally well-developed tear glands. Its resilience and adaptation to subterranean darkness fascinate researchers.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Pseudogiant Hand

A huge, malformed hand from a Pseudogiant, its knuckles covered in thick calluses. Its immense grip strength and bone density are studied for insights into extreme muscle mutations.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Psysucker Hand

A twisted, clawed appendage from a Psysucker, still faintly radiating psi-energy. Scientists hope studying it might reveal how psi-emissions interact with biological tissue.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Snork Tendons

These tendons, harvested from mutated Snorks, exhibit abnormal elasticity and resilience, likely a result of prolonged exposure to anomalous energy. Studying their unique properties could provide valuable insights into genetic mutations and bioengineering, potentially advancing medical science in areas such as tendon regeneration and synthetic muscle development.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Snork Mask

A damaged GP-5 gas mask fused to a Snork’s skull, a haunting reminder of the creature’s human origins. These were commonly used by soldiers as well as research and utility crews operating in the Zone when the second Chernobyl disaster occurred. Scientists collect them to study how the Zone alters both equipment and biology.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Tushkano Head

A severed head from the rodent-like Tushkano has developed specialized neural pathways that function as a rudimentary hivemind. This collective awareness enables packs to react to threats and opportunities almost instantly, making them surprisingly coordinated despite their small size and low intelligence. Scientists are eager to gain a better understanding of this phenomena.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
Zombie Hand

A decaying, partially human hand taken from a zombified stalker, disturbingly recognizable. Scientists study it for clues about the Zone’s zombification process and its neurological effects.
 
 %c[pda_white]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_purple] • %c[pda_white] Scientific Specimen
